newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 10.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 10.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

The 616.6 million parcel of Foster's shares owned by BHP was completely placed with institutional and private investors by Friday morning at A$2.49 a share. Some market watchers have seen Foster's share price settling down at the A$2.49 placement level as the stake is digested, but Were Stockbroking, which jointly placed the stake with ABN AMRO, has said there appeared to be untapped demand for the shares after the placement.

Aluminium producer Comalco Ltd planned to sell its Southern Aluminium wheel plant in the Australian state of Tasmania to Reynolds Metals Co of the United States, the Sydney Morning Herald newspaper said on Tuesday. The paper said the sale price would not match the A$50 million originally invested, but a loss on the deal was not expected.

Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd was poised to sign an Internet joint venture deal with Bill Gates' Microsoft Corp, The Australian Financial Review newspaper said on Tuesday. The new company would be the largest Internet company in the South Pacific region, the Microsoft sources told the Financial Review.

News Corp Ltd said on Monday that it filed counterclaims against EchoStar Communications Corp over a failed $1 billion merger proposal which would have offered up to 500 channels of digital TV, internet services and local broadcast TV signals to U.S. markets.
Pay television group Australis Media Ltd said it made a net after-tax loss of A$161.2 million in the nine months ended March 31, but before an abnormal loss of A$38.3 million.

Westpac Banking Corp said on Friday that it had sold its 2.99 percent stake in newspaper publisher John Fairfax Holdings Ltd. United States broker Merrill Lynch specialled the shares after the market closed at A$3.30 per share, the same as Fairfax's closing price and only two cents off the 1997 high.
